com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client
Class ChartObject

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.HasListeners
          com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.ChartObject

public class ChartObject
extends HasListeners

Represents a generic chart javascript object with all existing methods. Each chart implementation wraps only the appliable methods.

Method Detail

clearChart

public final void clearChart()
Clears the chart, and releases all of its allocated resources.

draw

public final void draw(DataSource data)
Draws the visualization on the page. Behind the scenes this can be fetching a graphic from a server or creating the graphic on the page using the linked visualization code. You should call this method every time the data or options change. The object should be drawn inside the DOM element passed into the constructor.

Parameters:
data - tipically a DataTable or DataView holding the data to use to draw the chart.
See Also:
draw() API reference

public final void draw(DataSource data,
                       Options options)
Draws the visualization on the page. Behind the scenes this can be fetching a graphic from a server or creating the graphic on the page using the linked visualization code. You should call this method every time the data or options change. The object should be drawn inside the DOM element passed into the constructor.

Parameters:
data - tipically a DataTable or DataView holding the data to use to draw the chart.
options - A map of name/value pairs of custom options.
See Also:
draw API reference

getMaxPossibleDepth

public final int getMaxPossibleDepth()
Currently only applies to TreeMap.
Returns the maximum possible depth for the current view.

Returns:
the maximum possible depth

getSelection

public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<Selection> getSelection()
This is optionally exposed by visualizations that want to let you access the currently selected data in the graphic.
Returns an array of selected objects, each one describing a data element in the underlying table used to create the visualization (a DataView or a DataTable). Each object has properties row and/or column, with the index of the row and/or column of the selected item in the underlying DataTable. If the row property is null, then the selection is a column; if the column property is null, then the selection is a row; if both are non-null, then it is a specific data item. You can call one of the DataTable.getValue() methods to get the value of the selected item. The retrieved array can be passed into setSelection(JsArray).

Returns:
an array of selected objects
See Also:
getSelection API reference

goUpAndDraw

public final void goUpAndDraw()
Currently only applies to TreeMap.
Move up the tree by one level and redraw it. Does not throw an error if the node is the root node. This is fired automatically when the user right-clicks a node.

setSelection

public final void setSelection(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<Selection> selection)
Selects a data entry in the visualization—for example, a point in an area chart, or a bar in a bar chart. When this method is called, the visualization should visually indicate what the new selection is. The implementation of setSelection() should not fire a "select" event. Visualizations may ignore part of the selection. For example, a table that can show only selected rows may ignore cell or column elements in its setSelection() implementation, or it can select the entire row. Every time this method is called, all selected items are deselected, and the new selection list passed in should be applied. There is no explicit way to deselect individual items; to deselect individual items, call setSelection() with the items to remain selected; to deselect all elements, call setSelection(), setSelection(null), or setSelection([]).

Parameters:
selection - an array of objects, each with a numeric row and/or column property
See Also:
setSelection API reference
